Story.title: Monica: What It Means To Be a Queen
Story.Description: 'It's so hard being perfect...'. The sun and envy of all of Drama-High - Monica is faced with constant trials and tribulations to maintain that perfection. But the fated Prom is only a week away... Will Monica find herself once more at the top? The queen of queens? Once more the envy of all the school? Or will she find a new path? Perhaps even, a path she never thought possible.

TidBit.text: Seems Monica is finding the votes for Prom Queen a little tougher than normal.
People just won't listen, and Monica can't figure out why.
Making friends to be Prom Queen is proving to be way harder than she thought.
Monica's phone is surprisingly quiet this year, worry sets in as The Prom draws near.
Monica may want to consider being a little nicer or she might find herself quite lonely.
Monica is really having to pull all the stops this year.
Looks like she'll have to appeal to her more... feminine side to get what she wants.
Juggling romantic relationships is proving to be really complicated for Monica. Even more than choosing what to wear for The Prom!
Becoming this puppet-master has never felt so empowering for Monica.
No one knows the secret to Monica's power of seduction, still - they can't help but to submit.
Monica has no idea un-popular kids had feelings too...
Seems Monica is finding out all sorts of things about the un-popular kids now.
Monica is starting to be friends with the un-popular kids, best not to make it too obvious.
Monica is becoming friends with kids who actually ride the *bus* to school!? What is going on!
Next thing you know, Monica's not going to be combing her hair and wearing *black*!

Level.title: Monday: In The Halls
Level.Description: In-between classes, Monica ran into a group of boys that she knew would do anything for a dance at The Prom. Maybe it's time to make the puppets 'dance' a little before class starts.

Level.title: Tuesday: At The Hangout
Level.Description: Tired of the stress from competing for Prom Queen; Monica decided to call up some of her 'friends' to let off some steam out-front of the movie theater while the day is still young. (PRETEND THIS NEIGHBOORHOOD IS A MOVIE THEATERRRRR)

Level.title: Wednesday: Through The Park
Level.Description: Monica was on the way home from school and decided to take the scenic route through the park. Where, lo-and-behold, she ran into some silly losers - those easiest to sway her way... Or so she thought.

Level.title: Thursday: During Lunch
Level.Description: Only one day left until the Prom... It's lunch time at school, with just enough time to appeal to the last resort - the female vote. And who better to appeal to than the females that envy her most... and... Gunther. (PRETEND THIS CORNERSTORE IS A QUADDDDDD)

Level.title: Friday: THE PROM
Level.Description: The. Prom. It's the BIG NIGHT. Everything Monica has been working hard for cashes out TO-NIGHT. Whether that be a good or bad thing, no one will know until the adult announcer sings.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I'd really love to dance... I wish someone would dance with me!
Or maybe some punch? So thirsty over here.
Anyone? Anyone at all? Helllllooo? Monica over here!
Do you simpletons know who you're dealing with!?
Someone! Please! Pay attention to me!
Oh... Why hello Tears... You're still my friend, right?
And you, little dust bunny?
Gang's all here... heh.. he...

Instantiation.name: Ending B: Prom Queen of Lust

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hohohohoho, revel at my feet simpletons! For I am your Queen ONCE MORE!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Monica, you're so gorgeous... Let us dance together and let the peasants gawk in jealousy!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Not so fast %r%! She's my girlfriend. Who do you think *you* are!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Girlfriend!? Who do *you* think you are, she's *my* girlfriend! I am her *King*!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Please, please, let us not figh-

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: King!? You're nothing more than a cheap fling! I'm who she really loves! You're just a figure-face.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: HAH! Do you not see this crown, peasant!? Know your role and leave us! Dance with your fellow poverty.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Come now %r%, don't worry about hi-

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Don't *worry* about me!? What about everything we shared, %sweetie%!? All those times... together... just the two of us?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: The two of you!? Please. It was all just a ploy from the beginning, %o%. You were played. ust one of the many puppets of our Highness.
I am who she really loves. Bwahaha...

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Is this... Is this true, my love? My Queen...?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Love? What would someone like you know of love? Please, return to your hovel and leave us. You and I... We are no longer the same.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Bwahaha, come my Queen. Our subjects await.
Hey Monica, you seem kinda lonely. What's up?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I didn't get Prom Queen this year, you %perjorative%! What do you *think* is up!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Come on Monica, it's not that big of a deal. It's just Prom Queen, who cares about that anyways.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Who *cares* about that!? Are you kidding me! Ugh, I wouldn't expect you guys to understand.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: We tried our best to vote you in Monica, I guess the popular kids just out-shadow us though.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Yeah! Besides, being popular is lame anyways. You've got to worry about all sorts of stupid things, all the time.
How do you guys even have time for fun!?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You mean... You guys don't worry about how your hair is or what you wear every morning?
Or what people think about you?!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: My *hair*? Are you serious? Have you seen my hair at school?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: No way Monica, we just care about chillin' and being ourselves. Who cares what anybody else thinks. Just relax!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hmmm... Maybe you guys are right. Maybe I am just being silly. Maybe being un-popular and being yourself is what life is really about!
You know what! I'm done being popular. Enough of these riches and fame!
I'm going to tell my Dad to sell my new sports car and cancel my country club membership tonight!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Whoa, whoa, whoa, Monica. Let's not be hasty... There's nothing wrong with having those things.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Yeah! That country club has a sick swimming pool!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Hey, so now that we're your friends - can we hang out at your place?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Of course! I'm glad I have friends like you guys!

Instantiation.name: Ending AB: Too Many To Dance With

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Can you *believe* that I didn't get elected Prom Queen this year, %r%!?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Yeah. I mean, no - I can't believe it. It's so lame. Oh well, no big deal - right?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: No big *deal*?! It's only the most IMPORTANT THING EVER! I don't know what I'm going to do anymore!
Who does :PROMQUEEN: think she is! I'm never going to hear the end of this!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Alright, alright %sweetie%. How about a dance? Would that get your mind off things?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: *Sigh*... I guess.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Whoa there %r%! She doesn't wanna dance with you!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh great, %o%. Who invited you to Prom?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: I'll have you know, Monica did.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Is this true, Monica? Did you really invite %o% to Prom as well as me?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I... Uh... Being Prom Queen is, yah know - really important... to me.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I can't believe this! I thought *I* was the one for you, Monica!
Didn't you say we'd share this night together!?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: She also told me the same thing, %gender(r,bro,chick)%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: No, no, no, it's not like that at all! Can't you guys just share, or something?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: *Share*?! Do you even *care* about other people's feelings?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: What's a feeling...?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: FORGET YOU, YOU %perjorative%!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Seriously! Enjoy the Prom *ALONE*!

Ending.name: Prom Queen of a Loser's Desire

Instantiation.name: Ending BC: Prom Queen of a Loser's Desire

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hey %sweetie%, time for that dance?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh... %r%. Yeah... About that dance.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Dance? Oh! Is it time for our dance, %sweetie%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: What are *you* doing here, %o%?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Funny, I was just wondering the same thing about you.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: She loves *me*, %o%. You should probably take a hike.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: *You*!? Hah! She doesn't care about you!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Doesn't care about me!? Please. She doesn't care about *you*!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ugh! I don't care about *EITHER* of you! The only thing *I* care about is being PROM QUEEN!
Which you %perjorative%s failed to induct me into! You're both USELESS!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: What do you mean, my %sweetie%?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Yeah, *my* %sweetie% - what do you mean?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Don't you %perjorative%s get it!? Ugh! I only care being the QUEEN!
You losers were just pawns! Leave me alone! As if someone like *me* would dance with *you*!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I... Wha... What....

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: I can't believe this! Why did I ever believe you! I knew you were nothing more than a stuck-up, preppy %perjorative%!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Yeah! How could you do this to us! We have feelings you know!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Stupid Monica. Although... What are you doing later, %r%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Don't know, I was thinking I'd sit around thinking about my feelings, how lame Monica is, and enjoy some punch.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Interesting, because I too have feelings, think Monica is lame and absolutely *love* punch! May I join you?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I would recommend it.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh! Hey %r%! How are you tonight?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Huh? Why are *you* talking to *me*, Monica?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ah.. Uh... Say, would you like to, maybe dance or something?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Dance!? With you? Why would I dance with a loser like you?
Sheesh, losing the run for Prom Queen really messed with your head.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Loser!? Do you know who you're talking to!? I'm not a-

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Uh huh. Keep telling yourself that. Oh, %o%.
Hey, %o%! You're not gonna believe this.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: What's that? Monica? What's a loser like her doing here?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I'm not a loser!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Can you believe this loser actually asked to *dance* with me!?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Hahahahaha! No way! Come on, forget her. Let's go get some punch.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I'm not a loser...
